intro: Saurauia borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean saurauia, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the tropical rainforests of Borneo, where it thrives in shaded, humid environments. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It produces small, fleshy berries that are often consumed by various bird species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Saurauia borneensis is considered a rare and ecologically significant plant.
